adjectives.description: informed (comparative more informed, superlative most informed)

entries.meaning: Instructed; having knowledge of a fact or area of education.
examples: An informed young man delivered a lecture on the history of modern art.
Synonyms: abreast, apprised, up to date, up-to-date

entries.meaning: Based on knowledge; founded on due understanding of a situation.
examples: Another informed and sobering estimate is that by 1800 indigenous populations in the western hemisphere were a tenth of what they had been three centuries before.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of inform

description: in- +‎ formed the first sense probably uses in- (“in”), the second sense uses in- (“prefix of negation”).

adjectives.description: informed (comparative more informed, superlative most informed)

examples: But, mindfull still of your first countries sight, Doe still preserve your first informed grace, Whose shadow yet shynes in your beauteous face

entries.meaning: (astronomy, obsolete) Not included within the figures of any of the ancient constellations.
